binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii, sewn on five bands; formerly chained from the usual position. The first and last leaves were pastedowns in an earlier binding.

history.provenance: At the foot of fol. iivis ‘Liber Willelmi Romsey qui fieri fecit.’ Given by William Rumsey, arriving in the College 25 May 1493, chained in the Library 2 Aug. 1494 (Registrum, pp. 173, 184). For Rumsey, see MS 12. He occasionally annotated.

At the foot of fol. 1 is ‘Liber Bibl: Coll: Merton.’, s. xvii. Inside the front board is a sheet of paper with a long table of contents and ‘F. 6, 9’ (canc.), and ‘N. 4. 8. Art:’, s. xvii, canc. and replaced with ‘C. 1. 8 (XLVII)’ in red. Alongside is ‘Breviloquium, F. 4. 9’, s. xvii. ‘8’ is inked on the foredge. The College bookplate is on fol. iiv.
